Acts of Apostles__08.1: And at that time there was raised a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all dispersed through the countries of Judea, and Samaria, except the apostles.
Acts of Apostles__08.2: And devout men took order for Stephen's funeral, and made great mourning over him.
Acts of Apostles__08.3: But Saul made havock of the church, entering in from house to house, and dragging away men and women, committed them to prison.
Acts of Apostles__08.4: They therefore that were dispersed, went about preaching the word of God.
Acts of Apostles__08.5: And Philip going down to the city of Samaria, preached Christ unto them.
Acts of Apostles__08.6: And the people with one accord were attentive to those things which were said by Philip, hearing, and seeing the miracles which he did.
Acts of Apostles__08.7: For many of them who had unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, went out.
Acts of Apostles__08.8: And many, taken with the palsy, and that were lame, were healed.
Acts of Apostles__08.9: There was therefore great joy in that city. Now there was a certain man named Simon, who before had been a magician in that city, seducing the people of Samaria, giving out that he was some great one:
Acts of Apostles__08.10: To whom they all gave ear, from the least to the greatest, saying: This man is the power of God, which is called great.
Acts of Apostles__08.11: And they were attentive to him, because, for a long time, he had bewitched them with his magical practices.
Acts of Apostles__08.12: But when they had believed Philip preaching of the kingdom of God, in the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
Acts of Apostles__08.13: Then Simon himself believed also; and being baptized, he adhered to Philip. And being astonished, wondered to see the signs and exceeding great miracles which were done.
Acts of Apostles__08.14: Now when the apostles, who were in Jerusalem, had heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John.
Acts of Apostles__08.15: Who, when they were come, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost.
Acts of Apostles__08.16: For he was not as yet come upon any of them; but they were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
Acts of Apostles__08.17: Then <u>they laid their hands upon them</u>, and they received the Holy Ghost.
Acts of Apostles__08.18: And when Simon saw, that by the imposition of the hands of the apostles, the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
Acts of Apostles__08.19: Saying: Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I shall lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost. But Peter said to him:
Acts of Apostles__08.20: Keep thy money to thyself, to perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
Acts of Apostles__08.21: Thou hast no part nor lot in this matter. For thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
Acts of Apostles__08.22: Do penance therefore for this thy wickedness; and pray to God, that perhaps this thought of thy heart may be forgiven thee.
Acts of Apostles__08.23: For I see thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bonds of iniquity.
Acts of Apostles__08.24: Then Simon answering, said: Pray you for me to the Lord, that none of these things which you have spoken may come upon me.
Acts of Apostles__08.25: And they indeed having testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel to many countries of the Samaritans.
Acts of Apostles__08.26: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying: Arise, go towards the south, to the way that goeth down from Jerusalem into Gaza: this is desert.
Acts of Apostles__08.27: And rising up, he went. And behold a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch, of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge over all her treasures, had come to Jerusalem to adore.
Acts of Apostles__08.28: And he was returning, sitting in his chariot, and reading Isaias the prophet.
Acts of Apostles__08.29: And the Spirit said to Philip: Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
Acts of Apostles__08.30: And Philip running thither, heard him reading the prophet Isaias. And he said: Thinkest thou that thou understandest what thou readest?
Acts of Apostles__08.31: Who said: And how can I, unless some man shew me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
Acts of Apostles__08.32: And the place of the scripture which he was reading was this: He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb without voice before his shearer, so openeth he not his mouth.
Acts of Apostles__08.33: In humility his judgment was taken away. His generation who shall declare, for his life shall be taken from the earth?
Acts of Apostles__08.34: And the eunuch answering Philip, said: I beseech thee, of whom doth the prophet speak this? of himself, or of some other man?
Acts of Apostles__08.35: Then Philip, opening his mouth, and beginning at this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.
Acts of Apostles__08.36: And as they went on their way, they came to a certain water; and the eunuch said: See, here is water: what doth hinder me from being baptized?
Acts of Apostles__08.37: And Philip said: <u>If thou believest with all thy heart</u>, thou mayest. And he answering, said: I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
Acts of Apostles__08.38: And he commanded the chariot to stand still; and they went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch: and he baptized him.
Acts of Apostles__08.39: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took away Philip; and the eunuch saw him no more. And he went on his way rejoicing.
Acts of Apostles__08.40: But Philip was found in Azotus; and passing through, he preached the gospel to all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
